summary: This is a forwarded email from July 17, 2019, containing a message from a source claiming to have communicated with a former employee of Jeffrey Epstein. The source alleges the employee was asked to procure 'girls' for Epstein after his release from house arrest, and provides additional context about media manipulation, political connections, and personal threats related to the investigation.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The central subject of the allegations; the document claims a former employee was asked to procure 'girls' for him after his release from house arrest.

persons.name: Gordon Ackley
persons.context: Mentioned as having a decade-old business relationship with Epstein; described as a yacht & media outlet owner and licensed microwave wireless operator in the USVI with links to VIGOP organizations.

persons.name: Dennis Hastert
persons.context: Referenced in relation to 'Foleygate'; the author notes Hastert lived nearby and claims knowledge of his predatory nature, having consulted for his opponent in the 2006 election.

persons.name: Bannon
persons.context: Mentioned in relation to a meeting with Epstein that allegedly occurred within 24 hours Â± 12 after the author published an 'abduction report'.

connections.description: The document references a > decade-old business relationship between Epstein and Ackley.
The author mentions a 'Bannon-Epstein meet' occurring within a specific timeframe after the author published a report.

events.title: Communication with Epstein employee begins
events.description: The author states they have been in communication with someone since December 2016 who claims to have been an employee of Jeffrey Epstein after his release from house arrest.

events.title: Email sent regarding recruitment allegations
events.description: The original email was sent detailing allegations that Epstein or his staff requested an employee help procure 'girls' for him after his incarceration.

events.title: Hastert indictment
events.description: The author references the timing of the SMARTech breach as linked to Dennis Hastert's 2015 indictment.

keyFacts: A source claims a former Epstein employee, after his release from house arrest, was asked by Epstein or his staff to help procure 'girls,' which she refused.
The author suggests evidence of this request may exist in an encrypted Signal archive they are willing to provide access to.
The document alleges a shift in media narrative from 'Spirit Cooking' to 'Pizzagate' was prompted by information given to AMI, intended to intimidate victims and discredit accusations.
The author references a business relationship between Epstein and Gordon Ackley, linking Ackley to VIGOP organizations in the US Virgin Islands.
The author claims personal threats have been made against them and their parents, making them 'pretty much unemployable' until the situation is fully resolved.
